title: Opportunistic location updates on API actions
description:
Many API actions are made by players whose current location is known to the client. Rather than relying solely on the dedicated POST /games/{game_id}/location endpoint, we should accept an optional location field on relevant requests and treat it as an implicit location update.

Candidate endpoints:
- POST /games/{game_id}/questions (seeker asking a question — already needs seeker location)
- POST /games/{game_id}/questions/{id}/lock-in (seeker locking in thermometer — uses latest location)
- POST /games/{game_id}/questions/{id}/answer (hider answering — snapshots hider location)

Benefits:
- Reduces location staleness for critical game actions
- Fewer dedicated location report round-trips needed
- More accurate question answers since location is fresh at the moment of action

Implementation:
- Add optional 'coordinates' (GeoJSON Point) + 'timestamp' fields to relevant request schemas
- When present, create a LocationUpdate before processing the main action
- Use the fresh location instead of querying the latest stored one
- Backward compatible: field is optional, existing behavior unchanged if omitted
